content.question: If g is a twice-differentiable function, where g(1) = 0.5 and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>→</mo> <mi>∞</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@461D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mi>∞</mi> </msubsup> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@435B@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
